groups

Class SymmetricGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • groups.SymmetricGroup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Group<SymmetricGroup>

    public class SymmetricGroup
extends java.lang.Object
implements Group<SymmetricGroup>
    A class that models the group of permutations on the set {0, 1, ..., n-1}, for any int n>0, implemented in the framework of the Group interface.

    Elements of the group are represented internally by an int array of length n containing a permutation of the integers 0, 1, ..., n-1.

    Author:
    pdokos

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SymmetricGroup(int[] perm)
      Constructor for a SymmetricGroup object, invoked by specifying an array containing some permutation of the set {0, 1, ..., n-1}, where n>0 is the length of the array.

      The value that m gets mapped to under this permutation.

      Returns the right action of h on the element making the call.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides the toString method so as to return a String representation the permutation, in the format of a list of integer values separated by single spaces, surrounded by square brackets.
      java.lang.String toUnpunctuatedString()
      Return a String representation of the permutation, in the format of a list of integer values separated by single spaces.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SymmetricGroup

        public SymmetricGroup(int[] perm)
        Constructor for a SymmetricGroup object, invoked by specifying an array containing some permutation of the set {0, 1, ..., n-1}, where n>0 is the length of the array.

        It is the responsibility of the client to ensure that the given array is a permutation.

        Parameters:
        perm - an int array listing the first n non-negative integers, n being the length of the array.

    • Method Detail

      • createCycle

        public static SymmetricGroup createCycle(int[] seq,
                         int n)
        A static helper for producing a SymmetricGroup element on n letters which is a cycle.
        Parameters:
        seq - An int array, representing a cycle, whose entries are from the set {0, 1, ..., n-1} and without repeated elements.
        n - The number of elements that the object permutes.
        Returns:
        The SymmetricGroup element representing the cycle specified by the parameters.

      • cycleDec2Perm

        public static SymmetricGroup cycleDec2Perm(int[][] cycles,
                           int n)
        A static helper for producing a SymmetricGroup element on n letters which is specified by a cycle decomposition.

        It is the responsibility of the client to ensure that cycles is a valid cycle decomposition.

        Parameters:
        cycles - An two-dimensional int array, not necessarily rectangular, representing a cycle decomposition, whose entries are from the set {0, 1, ..., n-1} and without repeated elements.
        n - The number of elements that the object permutes.
        Returns:
        The SymmetricGroup element representing the cycle specified by the parameters.

      • isAPermutation

        public static boolean isAPermutation(int[] arr)
        A static utility for checking if the given array represents a legitimate permutation that can be passed to the constructor of this class.
        Parameters:
        arr - an int array.
        Returns:
        true if the entries of the array consist of the values 0, 1, ..., n-1, in any order and without repetition (so that n is the length of the array).

        Returns:
        The identity element of SymmetricGroup on the set {0, 1, ..., n-1}.
